title: Plenary Session: Contributions of OER to SDG4 – From Commitments to Actions

author: Verena Metze-Mangold, German Commission for UNESCO

To our discussion of we are at this Congress.

The Internet is perhaps the most.
Important artifact of mankind.
It is at least a very astonishing artifact in the history of mankind and resulting.
In the shrinking of time and space.
As a mass phenomenon, it is nevertheless still very young, more or less, not more than 25 years.
But what exactly is the process of digitalization about?
Is it just a technical endeavor based on algorithms and para meters?
It certainly is not.
It is also a process of social construction.
For this transformation, changes not only all parts of the economic value chain, but our society as a whole.
UNESCO has a demanding vision for this Society of our future.
It is the humanistic vision.
Of universal knowledge societies.
The twenty 37th General Conference adopted the so called Internet Universality concept.
Which can serve as a template for the holistic and complex process of transforming and developing knowledge societies for the 21st century.
The concept itself is built on four pillars like the Temple of UNESCO, itself.
Human rights.
Openness.
Accessibility and the multi stakeholder process.

Even if the exact way in which knowledge societies are going to be established might be different, universal human rights have to be the frame of all these social transformation processes and the human right to education is central to that process and central to sustainable and inclusive social development.
Open educational resources.
We are one of the instruments that enable people to exercise the human right to education.
We are contributes to all of the major goals.
Of the so called sustainable development and especially sustainable development for, namely, inclusive.
And equitable quality education for all throughout all educational stages or levels.

We are contribute to inclusive education because they can be adjusted to diverse learning needs which leads to better learning outcomes.

Easily updated and adapted to specific contexts and thus made more relevant.

And to have fostered we are for more than 15 years.

Not much has changed since 2012.
The topic has not only attained greater visibility in public discourse.
But has also received increased political support.
The German Commission for UNESCO has been closely involved in these developments.
Let me mention only a few highlights and milestones in 2013.
The final report of a working group established by the German Federal Ministry for Educational Research and the German Federal States officially endorsed.
We are more recently 2016 national federal digitalization strategies, equally.
Promoted we are the most significant recent political development in Germany.
In the context of we are was the start of a national.
We are funding program by the Ministry of Education and Research.
In November last year.

This includes ladies and gentlemen.
The funding of 23 projects for capacity building of we are multipliers as well as the establishment of a national ovr information hub.

So we can state that these political developments have come about late, but have been all the more structured so that after political commitment right away, some steps towards mainstreaming have been undertaken.
Parallel to these political top down development, strong bottom up process has taken place.
the German we our community has continuously grown and developed an enormous variety of innovative project, big annual.

Our world map, which has been developed.
In Germany.
As it is an important project on a global scale.
The UER world map, funded into earlier by the Hewlett Foundation, collects and visualizes data, and we are actors and active activities worldwide.
I encourage all of you to registrant your Organism, organization and events and projects on this.
We are world map so that we can make the most of this extremely useful tool.
Projects like this can only be successful ladies and gentlemen.
If there is a broad cooperation of various players, this is even more true with regard to our global endeavors, especially as the G4.
Mainstreaming of we are is an important lever to this aim.
This is one of the reasons why this second we are World Congress is so pertinent and pertinent and timely.
